chefs.name: Mr. Boltu Mia
chefs.details: Chef Mr. Boltu Mia is a culinary expert with a decade of experience. He specializes in Italian cuisine and is passionate about using fresh, locally sourced ingredients to create delicious and nutritious meals.

recipes.cooking_method: Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add spices and coconut milk. Add prawns and simmer until cooked through. Serve with rice.

Fry the fish and set aside. Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add tomatoes and spices. Add water and simmer until the sauce thickens. Add the fish and cook for a few more minutes. Serve with rice.
Marinate the beef in spices and set aside. Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add tomatoes and cook until the sauce thickens. Add the beef and cook until tender. Serve with naan or rice.
Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices and set aside. Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add the chicken and cook until tender. Serve with rice or naan.
Mix rice flour, coconut, and sugar. Add milk to make a dough. Shape the dough and steam until cooked through. Serve with tea.
Boil the milk and let it cool down. Add yogurt and sugar and mix well. Pour the mixture into individual bowls and refrigerate until set. Serve chilled.

chefs.name: Kala Chan
chefs.details: Chef Kala Chan is a seasoned chef with a love for all things spicy. She has a vast repertoire of recipes from all around the world, and is constantly experimenting with new flavors and ingredients.

recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in spices and set aside. Fry the potatoes and set aside. Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add the chicken and cook until tender. Layer rice, chicken, and potatoes in a pot and cook until the rice is tender. Serve with raita, salad, or chutney.
Marinate the lamb in spices and set aside. Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add tomatoes and cook until the sauce thickens. Add the lamb and cook until tender. Serve with naan or rice.
Marinate the fish in spices and set aside. Make a batter using flour, egg, and spices. Dip the fish in the batter and fry until crispy. Serve with mint chutney.

Sautee onion, ginger, and garlic, then add spinach and cook until wilted. Blend the mixture and set aside. Fry paneer and set aside. Sautee the blended mixture, add spices, and cook until the sauce thickens. Add the paneer and cook for a few more minutes. Serve with rice or naan.

Mix gram flour, yogurt, and sugar to make a batter. Steam the batter until cooked through. Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves, and fry until fragrant. Pour the mixture over the dhokla and serve with green chutney.

Boil the milk and let it cool down. Add lemon juice and let it curdle. Strain the curdled milk and knead it to make balls. Boil water and sugar with cardamom, and add the milk balls. Cook until the balls double in size. Garnish with almonds and pistachios and serve chilled.
Sautee onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add beef and cook until browned. Add tomatoes and spices, and cook until the sauce thickens. Serve with rice or naan.

chefs.name: Laltu Miya
chefs.details: Chef Laltu Miya is a master of fusion cuisine, blending traditional Asian flavors with modern techniques and ingredients. He has worked in some of the most prestigious kitchens in the world, and his dishes are renowned for their complexity and depth of flavor.
